div.l: Sauyng a childe that was of halfe yere age
In cradel it lay · and was a ꝓpropre page
This wenche thikke and wele y growen was
With camuse nose / and eyen grey as glas
With buttokkes brode / and brestes rounde and hye
And right faire was hire here / I wolle nat lye
The ꝑpersoun of the toun for she was faire
In purpos was to maken hire his ayre
Bothe of his catel and of his mesuage
And straunge he made it of hire mariage
His purpos was to bystowe hire hye
In to som worthy blood of Auncestrye
For holy chirches good mote bēn dispended
On holy chirches blood that is descended
Therfore he wolde his holy blood honoure

rdg.seg: Thowgh that he holy chyrche shold deuoure

div.l: Greet sookne hath this Millere oute of doute
With wheet and malt of al the lande a boute
And namely ther was a greet Collegge
Men clepeth the Soler halle / at Cantebregge
There was hire wheet / and eke hire malte y grounde
And on a day / it happed on a stounde
Syke lay the Mauncyple / on a Maladie
Men wenden wisly / that he sholde dye
For whiche this Millere stale both mele and corn
An hundred tyme more than byforn
For there byforn he stale but curteisly
But now he was a theef outrageously
For whiche the wardeyn chidde and made fare
But ther of sette the Millere not a tare
He craked boost and swore it was nat soo
Thanne were there yonge pore scolers too
That dwelten in the halle / of whiche I sey
Testyf they were / and lusty for to pley
And oonly for hire myrthe / and reuerye
Vpon the wardeyn besyly they crye
To yeue hem leue but a lytel stounde
To goon to Mille / and sen her corn y grounde
And hardely they durst ley her nekke
The Millere sholde nat stele hem halfe a pekke
